intro: Cruciata humifusa, commonly known as the groundsel or common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Cruciata humifusa is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in many regions.
